intro: Scleria latilacunosa, commonly known as the broad-pored sedges, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in wet or moist environments such as marshes, swamps, and along riverbanks. Its rhizomatous growth habit allows it to spread and form dense stands, which can help stabilize soil. Scleria latilacunosa is often found in temperate regions of the Americas and is adapted to a variety of aquatic and semi-aquatic habitats.
